Title: Los Angeles wildfire switches direction, posing new threat
Description: The largest of the raging wildfires that have devastated parts of Los Angeles this week was reported to have shifted direction on Saturday, triggering more evacuation orders and posing a new challenge to exhausted firefighters, News.az reports citing Reuters.

Title: An earthquake occurred in Armenia
Description: An earthquake occurred 1 km north of Spitak in Armenia, News.az reports, citing the Rescue Service of the Ministry of Internal Affairs of Armenia.

Title: Four Islamic State members, including two leaders, killed in east...
Description: Four members of the Islamic State, including two senior leaders, were killed in an airstrike carried out by Iraqi aircraft in the Hamrin Mountains in eastern Iraq, security officials said on Saturday, News.az reports citing Reuters.

Title: Emergency response activated for Angola's cholera outbreak: healt...
Description: Angola's Minister of Health Silvia Lutucuta announced on Saturday that emergency response plans have been activated to address the country's cholera outbreak, particularly in Cacuaco Municipality of Luanda province, the epicenter of the disease, News.az reports citing Xinhua.

Title: Georgian FM plans visit to Azerbaijan
Description: Georgia's Foreign Minister, Maka Bochorishvili, is set to visit Azerbaijan, according to the Georgian Foreign Ministry statement, News.az reports citing Trend.

Title: Ukraine claims capture of North Korean soldiers as Russia reports...
Description: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy announced on Saturday that Ukraine had captured two North Korean soldiers who were fighting alongside Russian troops in Russia’s Kursk border region, News.az reports citing The Independent.

Title: Kabul urges Islamabad to halt attacks in Afghanistan
Description: The Afghan Taliban interim administration has urged Pakistan to halt cross-border attacks inside Afghanistan, News.az reports citing TRT World.

Title: Biden: Putin is in a tough position, Ukraine has a chance to win
Description: On January 10, President Joe Biden stated that Russian President Vladimir Putin is 'in tough shape' following the new energy sector sanctions imposed by the US and UK on Moscow, News.az reports citing foreign media.

Title: Azerbaijan and Latvia explore opportunities for tax cooperation
Description: Orkhan Nazarli, Head of the State Tax Service under Azerbaijan’s Ministry of Economy, President of the Intra-European Organisation of Tax Administrations (IOTA), held a virtual meeting with Baiba Šmite-Roķe, Director General of the State Revenue Service of Latvia, News.az reports.

Title: Toyota hints at F1 comeback with return under consideration
Description: Toyota is 'gradually moving' towards a full return to Formula 1 after entering into a technical partnership with Haas for the 2024 season, confirmed Masaya Kaji, the director of global motorsport at Toyota, News.az reports citing foreign media.

Title: UK rejects call to boycott Champions Trophy against Afghanistan
Description: The British government has stated that England should proceed with their cricket match against Afghanistan, scheduled for February 26 in the Champions Trophy, despite a boycott request from over 160 parliamentarians protesting the Taliban regime's treatment of women in Afghanistan, News.az reports citing foreign media.

Title: Israel's Gaza war costs exceed $67B, report says
Description: The economic toll of Israel's ongoing war on Gaza reached approximately 250 billion shekels ($67.57 billion) by the end of 2024, according to a report, News.az reports citing foreign media.

Title: Milan railway chaos likely caused by two trains
Description: Two trains allegedly caused the malfunction of the Milan railway network Saturday that had nationwide repercussions, News.az reports citing foreign media

Title: Syrian authorities prevent Daesh bombing plot near Damascus
Description: The Syrian Interior Ministry announced that it successfully foiled an attempt by the Daesh/ISIS terror group to bomb the Sayyida Zaynab shrine near Damascus on Saturday, News.az reports citing foreign media.

Title: Biden administration criticized for 'waiting' to declare genocide...
Description: Senator Jim Risch criticized the Biden administration for delaying the declaration of genocide in Sudan, only making the announcement with just 13 days left in the outgoing president's term. This came amid ongoing, brutal conflict in Sudan that has persisted for 21 months, News.az reports citing Fox news.
